info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 25 at 6:59PM CDT until May 25 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HANCOCK AND MCDONOUGH COUNTIES... At 659 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Webster to Pennington Point, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Western Illinois University, Macomb, Blandinsville, Bardolph, New Philadelphia, Macomb Municipal Airport, La Harpe, Good Hope, Disco, Scottsburg, Bushnell, Prairie City, Walnut Grove and Prairie City Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room.
